title: Landmark climate change case opens at top UN court as island nations fear rising seas
content: The top UN court has commenced hearings on the legal responsibilities of countries to combat climate change and assist vulnerable nations. The case, pushed by island nations facing rising sea levels, seeks to establish international legal obligations and consequences for actions affecting the climate, with input from 99 countries and various organizations.
summary: The top UN court has commenced hearings on the legal responsibilities of countries to combat climate change and assist vulnerable nations. The case, pushed by island nations facing rising sea levels, seeks to establish international legal obligations and consequences for actions affecting the climate, with input from 99 countries and various organizations.

title: 'You guys are f**king crazy': Woman insults Indian-American family, caught on camera
content: A woman was captured on video being racist towards Pervez Taufiq and his Indian American family during a United Airlines transfer bus ride in Los Angeles. The incident followed her alleged harassment of Taufiq’s son during their flight. United Airlines staff intervened after bystanders confirmed her as the aggressor, leading to her removal from the bus.
summary: A woman was captured on video being racist towards Pervez Taufiq and his Indian American family during a United Airlines transfer bus ride in Los Angeles. The incident followed her alleged harassment of Taufiq’s son during their flight. United Airlines staff intervened after bystanders confirmed her as the aggressor, leading to her removal from the bus.

title: Hunter vows to make 'amends and rebuild lives' after father Joe Biden pardons him
content: Hunter Biden, after receiving a presidential pardon from his father Joe Biden, expressed remorse for past mistakes during his addiction struggles. Highlighting his five-year sobriety, he committed to helping others with addiction. The pardon, defended by President Biden, sparked varied reactions amidst political accusations.
summary: Hunter Biden, after receiving a presidential pardon from his father Joe Biden, expressed remorse for past mistakes during his addiction struggles. Highlighting his five-year sobriety, he committed to helping others with addiction. The pardon, defended by President Biden, sparked varied reactions amidst political accusations.

title: 'What worked in Wisconsin can work nationwide': Ben Wikler joins DNC chair race after 2024 defeat
content: Wisconsin Democratic Party Chair Ben Wikler announced his candidacy for DNC chair to guide the party following the 2024 election victory by Republicans and Donald Trump. Wikler emphasizes year-round organization in various regions, citing successes in Wisconsin such as flipping the state Supreme Court majority and re-electing Governor Tony Evers, aiming to replicate these achievements nationally.
summary: Wisconsin Democratic Party Chair Ben Wikler announced his candidacy for DNC chair to guide the party following the 2024 election victory by Republicans and Donald Trump. Wikler emphasizes year-round organization in various regions, citing successes in Wisconsin such as flipping the state Supreme Court majority and re-electing Governor Tony Evers, aiming to replicate these achievements nationally.

title: Georgia protest enters fourth night of clash after suspension of EU talks: What we know so far
content: Protests in Georgia continue for a fourth night, sparked by the suspension of EU membership talks, leading to confrontations between police and demonstrators across the country. Critics allege the government is leaning towards authoritarianism and closer ties with Russia. The unrest has resulted in injuries and hospitalizations among protesters, police, and a media worker.
summary: Protests in Georgia continue for a fourth night, sparked by the suspension of EU membership talks, leading to confrontations between police and demonstrators across the country. Critics allege the government is leaning towards authoritarianism and closer ties with Russia. The unrest has resulted in injuries and hospitalizations among protesters, police, and a media worker.

title: 'Who stole his phone?': Bernie Sanders backs Trump's DOGE initiative, Elon Musk, netizens react
content: Senator Bernie Sanders endorsed President-elect Donald Trump's Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) initiative targeting Pentagon spending. He expressed concern over the Pentagon's $886 billion budget and audit failures. Sanders emphasized the necessity for change in federal and defense spending, highlighting that only 13 senators opposed the defense budget last year.
summary: Senator Bernie Sanders endorsed President-elect Donald Trump's Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) initiative targeting Pentagon spending. He expressed concern over the Pentagon's $886 billion budget and audit failures. Sanders emphasized the necessity for change in federal and defense spending, highlighting that only 13 senators opposed the defense budget last year.

title: Hitman offered $71,000 to kill Canadian reporter who was covering his trial, admits to plot
content: A hitman, Frédérick Silva, convicted of multiple murders, admits to offering C$100,000 to kill Montreal crime reporter Daniel Renaud. The plot remained active for two months but was not executed. Quebec Premier François Legault denounced the plot, emphasizing continued police action against organized crime.
summary: A hitman, Frédérick Silva, convicted of multiple murders, admits to offering C$100,000 to kill Montreal crime reporter Daniel Renaud. The plot remained active for two months but was not executed. Quebec Premier François Legault denounced the plot, emphasizing continued police action against organized crime.

title: Prince William was jealous of Harry before his wedding: Report
content: Prince Harry revealed his brother, Prince William, was envious of his beard during Harry's wedding to Meghan. Despite military protocol, Harry received permission from the Queen to keep his beard, sparking a week-long quarrel between the brothers. The rule has since been amended, and William now sports a beard with approval.
summary: Prince Harry revealed his brother, Prince William, was envious of his beard during Harry's wedding to Meghan. Despite military protocol, Harry received permission from the Queen to keep his beard, sparking a week-long quarrel between the brothers. The rule has since been amended, and William now sports a beard with approval.

title: 'Miscarriage of justice': Trump slams Biden's presidential pardon for son Hunter
content: US President-elect Donald Trump criticized outgoing President Joe Biden's decision to pardon Hunter Biden for gun crimes and tax violations, labeling it a miscarriage of justice. Biden defended the pardon, stating the charges were politically motivated. Trump's reaction hints at possible pardons for January 6 rioters once he takes office.
summary: US President-elect Donald Trump criticized outgoing President Joe Biden's decision to pardon Hunter Biden for gun crimes and tax violations, labeling it a miscarriage of justice. Biden defended the pardon, stating the charges were politically motivated. Trump's reaction hints at possible pardons for January 6 rioters once he takes office.

title: Oxford's word of the year is 'brain rot'. What it means
content: Oxford's word of the year for 2024 is 'brain rot', highlighting concerns over excessive social media use and low-quality content. With over 37,000 votes, it reflects fears of declining mental capacity from trivial online material. The term, originating in 1854, gained popularity among Gen Z and Gen Alpha. Other shortlisted terms included 'demure', 'dynamic pricing', and 'slop'.
summary: Oxford's word of the year for 2024 is 'brain rot', highlighting concerns over excessive social media use and low-quality content. With over 37,000 votes, it reflects fears of declining mental capacity from trivial online material. The term, originating in 1854, gained popularity among Gen Z and Gen Alpha. Other shortlisted terms included 'demure', 'dynamic pricing', and 'slop'.

title: What charges did Hunter Biden face before father and US President Joe pardoned him?
content: US President Joe Biden has granted a full pardon to his son, Hunter Biden, covering federal gun and tax charges from 2014 to 2024. Hunter faced convictions for firearm purchase under false claims and unpaid taxes. The pardon eliminates potential prison time, amidst claims of politically motivated prosecution.
summary: US President Joe Biden has granted a full pardon to his son, Hunter Biden, covering federal gun and tax charges from 2014 to 2024. Hunter faced convictions for firearm purchase under false claims and unpaid taxes. The pardon eliminates potential prison time, amidst claims of politically motivated prosecution.

title: 'I hope Americans will understand': In U-turn, US president Joe Biden pardons son Hunter in gun, tax fraud charges
content: US President Joe Biden has granted a full and unconditional pardon to his son, Hunter Biden, for federal crimes committed between January 2014 and December 2024. Hunter Biden was convicted of gun and tax fraud. President Biden justified the pardon, citing unfair prosecution and political motivations behind the charges, emphasizing his son's recovery from addiction.
summary: US President Joe Biden has granted a full and unconditional pardon to his son, Hunter Biden, for federal crimes committed between January 2014 and December 2024. Hunter Biden was convicted of gun and tax fraud. President Biden justified the pardon, citing unfair prosecution and political motivations behind the charges, emphasizing his son's recovery from addiction.

title: Former US National Security Advisor compares Trump’s pick of Kash Patel for FBI head to a Stalin-era appointment
content: Former US National Security Advisor John Bolton vehemently criticized President-elect Trump's nomination of Kash Patel for FBI Director, equating it to Soviet tactics. Bolton urged the Senate to unanimously reject Patel, who has expressed intentions to overhaul the FBI and has been a divisive figure in the past.
summary: Former US National Security Advisor John Bolton vehemently criticized President-elect Trump's nomination of Kash Patel for FBI Director, equating it to Soviet tactics. Bolton urged the Senate to unanimously reject Patel, who has expressed intentions to overhaul the FBI and has been a divisive figure in the past.

title: 'Our brand is toxic': Former US Democratic lawmaker calls for 'complete reset' of party after Harris loss to Trump
content: Former US Democratic lawmaker Tim Ryan called for a significant overhaul of the party, labeling its image as 'toxic' in many areas. He stressed the need for a rebrand and a focus on working-class policies. Contrarily, Bernie Sanders and Nancy Pelosi hold differing views on the party's direction.
summary: Former US Democratic lawmaker Tim Ryan called for a significant overhaul of the party, labeling its image as 'toxic' in many areas. He stressed the need for a rebrand and a focus on working-class policies. Contrarily, Bernie Sanders and Nancy Pelosi hold differing views on the party's direction.

title: Why the happiest country can't stop greening
Bus crash near French ski resort kills two, injures 33
content: A deadly bus accident near France's Porte-Puymorens ski resort resulted in the death of at least two people and injuries to 33 others, with seven critically injured. The bus, carrying 47 passengers, struck a cliff for reasons still under investigation. Rescue operations included over 120 personnel from France, Andorra, and Spain.
summary: A deadly bus accident near France's Porte-Puymorens ski resort resulted in the death of at least two people and injuries to 33 others, with seven critically injured. The bus, carrying 47 passengers, struck a cliff for reasons still under investigation. Rescue operations included over 120 personnel from France, Andorra, and Spain.

title: DOGE duo of Musk and Ramaswamy criticise 'deep state' bureaucracy
content: Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy criticized 'deep state' bureaucracy following MSNBC's comments on Kash Patel, labeling it a threat to democracy. Musk and Ramaswamy will lead the Department of Government Efficiency under Trump, aiming to reform federal bureaucracy and reduce wasteful spending by 2026.
summary: Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy criticized 'deep state' bureaucracy following MSNBC's comments on Kash Patel, labeling it a threat to democracy. Musk and Ramaswamy will lead the Department of Government Efficiency under Trump, aiming to reform federal bureaucracy and reduce wasteful spending by 2026.

title: Bangladesh HC acquits Zia’s son in 2004 grenade attack cases
‘Virtually zero risk’: Rabies expert questions killing of pet squirrel Peanut
content: The New York State DEC euthanised popular pet squirrel P’Nut and rescued raccoon Fred, sparking criticism from experts and animal rights advocates. Despite quarantine alternatives, the animals were killed for rabies testing following a questionable bite incident. Mark Longo, their caretaker, had been working to secure permits. Legal action and public outrage have ensued over the controversial act.
summary: The New York State DEC euthanised popular pet squirrel P’Nut and rescued raccoon Fred, sparking criticism from experts and animal rights advocates. Despite quarantine alternatives, the animals were killed for rabies testing following a questionable bite incident. Mark Longo, their caretaker, had been working to secure permits. Legal action and public outrage have ensued over the controversial act.

title: 'Willingness to lie to govt': Vivek Ramaswamy criticises US immigration system
content: Vivek Ramaswamy criticizes the US immigration system for rewarding dishonesty over genuine asylum claims. He stresses the need for reform, echoing Trump’s policies on securing borders and enforcing the rule of law. Ramaswamy emphasizes lawful entry and opposes benefits for undocumented immigrants.
summary: Vivek Ramaswamy criticizes the US immigration system for rewarding dishonesty over genuine asylum claims. He stresses the need for reform, echoing Trump’s policies on securing borders and enforcing the rule of law. Ramaswamy emphasizes lawful entry and opposes benefits for undocumented immigrants.
